abstract.text: Reflect, shear, rotate, scale, and apply affine transforms to image data.

metadata.title: Applying geometric operations to pixel buffers

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Multiply the pixel values of a buffer by scalar values or matrices.
Extract, flatten, permute, and overwrite the individual color channels of a pixel buffer.
Adjust the colors of an image by applying gamma, polynomials, or multidimensional lookup.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Applying color transforms to pixel buffers

abstract.text: Composite two pixel buffers to create a single image.
Enhance and adjust the contrast of an image with histogram equalization, contrast stretching, and specification.
Convert pixel buffer data between different bit-depths.
Apply convolution, dilation, or erosion to a pixel buffer.
Crop images and apply operations to regions of interest.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Cropping and working with regions of interest

abstract.text: Convert pixel buffer data between interleaved and planar formats.
Limit the values in a pixel buffer to a threshold or a range.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Thresholding and clipping pixel buffer values

abstract.text: An enumeration that acts as a namespace for Swift overlays to vImage.
An image buffer that stores an imageâ€™s pixel data, dimensions, bit depth, and number of channels.
